title: [BEAM-9615] Custom Schema Coder Support
body:
Adds "custom schema coder" support. I believe Python and Java call these providers, but that's not exactly what's happening in the Go SDK. This PR adds the ability to register a factory function for schema coder functions for a given type. This enables overriding the default behavior for Go types in the schema coders with a custom one, for the type itself, or any matching interface. To ensure users *can* write custom schema coders, a testing utility has been added to validate the factory functions, and ensure the coders encode to a valid schema equivalent type. Benchmarks were added to demonstrate the umbrella helper coder functions, using a custom coder function, registering a custom coder function, and comparing to the equivalent we use for JSON encoding at present. There are more details to work on here, but this moves everything closer to having fields of an umbrella type be encoded properly without breaking things, eg. for hanlding proto fields, which aren't encoded as proper JSON. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: Fix for Kafka To PubSub Example
body:
In case if `trustoreLocation` and/or `keystoreLocation` parameters aren't specified the pipeline would fail. This PR fixes this issue. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-11520] Stage extra PyPI dependencies with generated requirements
body: This PR creates a PyPI requirement file from the string representing PyPI package names and versions and stages them with the other Python artifacts. This was for multi-language pipelines where Java pipeline users or Python expansion service authors may want to specify Python dependencies programmatically.

title: Fix for Java container release
body:
Also changing ssh to https login in github, but that's more flexible. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-11515] Add check for missing authors, add missing authors
body:
I noticed that we were missing a lot of author definitions (including my own) when I wrote the DataFrame blog post. This prevents them from rendering: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/675055/102939146-8b54b400-4462-11eb-8001-5b62ba4ed217.png) This PR adds a check to fail the website build if an author isn't defined, and adds the missing authors. It also adds `` tags to release blog posts so they break correctly. Otherwise they are broken on the first '.' in the version number: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/675055/102939081-67916e00-4462-11eb-93c9-1ccfbadaf8d0.png) Post-Commit Tests Status (on master branch) ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ Lang | SDK | Dataflow | Flink | Samza | Spark | Twister2 --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- Go | [![Build Status](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go/lastCompletedBuild/) | --- | [![Build Status](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go_VR_Flink/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go_VR_Flink/lastCompletedBuild/) | --- | [![Build Status](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go_VR_Spark/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go_VR_Spark/lastCompletedBuild/) | --- Java | [![Build Status](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java/lastCompletedBuild/) | [![Build Status](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java_ValidatesRunner_Dataflow/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java_ValidatesRunner_Dataflow/lastCompletedBuild/)

title: [BEAM-11159] Use official GCP client in TestPubSubSignal
body:
As with TestPubsub (https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/13273), the official GCP client is a better choice for this application since it has better tuned timeout and retry policies. title: [BEAM-11512] Don't cache sdk.properties.
body:
R: @runningcode @pabloem This shouldn't affect the rest of the build cache thanks to #13464. I believe #13464 was written with the assumption that `sdk.properties` was constantly changing, though it wasn't actually changing at all. Nelson, please let me know if my understanding is correct. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-10925] Add UdfProvider interface.
body:
R: @amaliujia @apilloud cc: @pabloem This is the last one we'll have to cherry-pick to get the entire SQL UDF API in Beam 2.27. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-10986] Fix for update shadow jar plugin.
body:
Since [updating shadow JAR plugin](https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/13453) some of the shadow JAR were not build properly. This commit upgrades shadow JAR plugin again to resolve these issues. Apache Spark SparkStructuredStreaming Runner ValidatesRunner Tests fails also on master (21 Dec 2020). ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-10160] Change API to enable to append to Iceberg
body:
Exploring how to write Iceberg tables using Beam. By removing the PDone, and emit the files that are written, we can add these to the [Table Format, such as Iceberg](https://conferences.oreilly.com/strata/strata-ny-2018/cdn.oreillystatic.com/en/assets/1/event/278/Introducing%20Iceberg_%20Tables%20designed%20for%20object%20stores%20Presentation.pdf), Hudi or Delta. Exploring the possible approaches, but I think this is a very fruitful direction since we can fully re-use the existing `Avro/Parquet/..` writers, and emit the WriteFilesResult to the next operator, which will append the new files to the Iceberg log. My suggestion would be to change the API in Apache Beam so we can use the `WriteFilesResult`. Add the Iceberg extension in the Iceberg repository itself. This will be a `PTransform, PDone>`. Maybe I'll change the `PDone` to a `Table` (Iceberg Table) as well. So you can signal downstream consumers. I'll open this PR somewhere next week, but would like to know your idea's as well! :) ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-10658] Update website to recommend the right version
body:
Docs were referring to 2.24.0 instead of 2.25.0. PR #12494 was first included in 2.25.0. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: Fix regex in Kotlin MinimalWordCount example.
body:
MinimalWordCount example in Kotlin was broken, as the regex was treated as a plain string instead of a regex. Added `toRegex` (see https://kotlinlang.org/api/latest/jvm/stdlib/kotlin.text/to-regex.html) to fix. No JIRA issue for this, sorry. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [x] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [x] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-3245] Release bundle processor when any exceptions during processing.
body:
It seems like we don't release bundle processor when there is an exception during processing, which leads to we keep too many unnecessary active bundle processor. r: @kennknowles ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: Use portable job submission by default for Go.
body:
Use portable Job submission for Dataflow jobs from the Go SDK. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-11494][BEAM-11821] FileIO stops overwriting files on retries
body:
In this case, the default behavior for FileIO changes slightly: - Before this change, FileIO copies temp files into destination locations without checking whether destinations exist. - With the new change, if the destination file exists already, nothing will be copied. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: Revert "Do not add unnecessary experiment use_multiple_sdk_containers."
body:
Reverts apache/beam#13475

Reason: for streaming jobs new codepath using UW (https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/9f97585160fae644d9b4a7f0dca6558c82c29723/sdks/python/apache_beam/runners/dataflow/internal/apiclient.py#L276) is not yet triggered by default. 

So, at this time Dataflow first need to change the behavior to not require `use_multiple_sdk_containers` for streaming pipelines, or we need to use UW codepath for all streaming pipelines in Beam.

title: [BEAM-11460] Support reading Parquet files with unknown schema
body:
Data engineers encounter times when schema of Parquet file is unknown at the time of writing the pipeline or multiple schema may be present in different files. Reading Parquet files using ParquetIO requires providing an Avro (equivalent) schema, Many a times its not possible to know the schema of the Parquet files. On the other hand [AvroIO](https://beam.apache.org/releases/javadoc/2.26.0/org/apache/beam/sdk/io/AvroIO.html) supports reading unknow schema files by providing a parse function : `#parseGenericRecords(SerializableFunction)` Supporting this functionality in ParquetIO is simple and requires minimal changes to the ParquetIO surface. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] Added new tests for the feature in `ParquetIOTest` - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @lgajowy and @jbonofre`). - [x] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [x] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-11196] Fix `None` parent when fusing >2 stages
body:
Fixes a bug introduced by #13202 where the parent for a fused stage (or packed combiner) gets set to `None` if more than two stages are fused (or packed). This occurs because `_lowest_common_ancestor` uses the `subtransforms` field of the `PipelineContext`'s transforms to figure out parent-child relationships. However, a stage that is created by fusion or by another optimizer phase will not be present in the `PipelineContext`'s transforms. As a result, such a stage is passed to `_lowest_common_ancestor`, it will return `None`. This change fixes it by additionally using the `parent` field of the input stages. This bug only affects runners that use `translations.pipeline_from_stages` with `partial=True`. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [x] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-11230] Fix a bug with decoding repeated fields
body:
A user reported problem with decoding repeated, non-record BigQuery fields (see jira ticket's description). Now all cases (repeatable, record; repeatable, non-record; non-repeatable, record; non-repeatable, non-record) should be supported by the coder. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-11444] Python IO MongoDB: mask password in display_data uri and spec.
body:
This enhances MongoDB connector to mask password in display_data as described in BEAM-11444. Display data before this change: ``` "uri": mongodb+srv://top:secret@xyx456-pri.ab123.mongodb.net "mongo_client_spec": {"username": "top", "password": "secret"} ``` Display data after this change: ``` "uri": mongodb+srv://top:******@xyx456-pri.ab123.mongodb.net "mongo_client_spec": {"username": "top", "password": "******"} ``` ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [x] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-11338] Addendum: handle private fields in generated thrift code
body:
For thrift classes generated with `java:beans` or `java:private-members` (i.e. private fields), the current code will fail to infer the `FieldValueTypeInformation`, as it wrongly expects the fields to be public.
This PR fixes the issue and changes the thrift compiler params to showcase this scenario.

title: [BEAM-11360] Updates Dataflow Python multi-language pipelines to use portable job submission by default
body:
Also cleans up multi-language pipelines related hooks in Python SDK that are not needed when we use portable job submission (hence directly generate Dataflow steps from the Runner API proto). These hooks were mostly were added in PRs https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/8270 and https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/11185. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-11429] User-friendly names for packed combiners
body:
This improves the readability of the stage and transform names for transforms and stages resulting from the `translations.eliminate_common_key_with_none` and `translations.pack_combiners`. This also fixes an issue where the transform name was incorrectly set to the stage name. For example, for `TranslationsTest.test_pack_combiners`, previously both the Pack transform and stage were set to `(ref_AppliedPTransform_multiple-combines/mean-perkey/CombinePerKey(MeanCombineFn)_16)+(ref_AppliedPTransform_multiple-combines/count-perkey/CombinePerKey(CountCombineFn)_21)/Pack`. After this change, the Pack transform name is set to `multiple-combines/Packed[mean-perkey/CombinePerKey(MeanCombineFn), count-perkey/CombinePerKey(CountCombineFn)]/Pack` and the Pack stage name is set to `ref_AppliedPTransform_multiple-combines/Packed[mean-perkey/CombinePerKey(MeanCombineFn)_16, count-perkey/CombinePerKey(CountCombineFn)_21]/Pack`. The Unpack transform and stage are named similarly, but with the suffix `/Unpack` instead of `/Pack`. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: Fix missing bracket in the 2.25 signature.
body:
Fix missing bracket in the 2.25 signature. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). body:

Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-11433] Prevent defaulting to java11 container
body:
See JIRA for context - this disables defaulting to a Java 11 container (added in #12505, cherrypicked out of 2.26 (#13497). This doesn't disable the release or build of java11 containers, so they can technically still be used, but won't break existing x-lang users who are running Java11 pipelines. R: @kennknowles R: @chamikaramj ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-11415][BEAM-11416] Move Go ValidatesRunner tests and add filtering
body:
Merges the ValidatesRunner tests (basically just cross-language) and framework with the existing integration test code and adds the ability to filter/sickbay tests. Adjusts existing integration tests to also work with the new framework. Finally, adds gradle targets for running the script with Spark and Python Portable runners. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-11329] HDFS not deduplicating identical configuration paths
body:
Fix bug https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-11329 by adding Path checking before adding the path to the list. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier).
